messages.message:
We come from France.  No, wait, *you* come from France.
Hey there - just don't forget to keep me in the loop if there ends up being something we can collude on.
messages.input:
My response to FRANCE:'We come from France.  No, wait, *you* come from France.
Hey there - just don't forget to keep me in the loop if there ends up being something we can collude on.'.

messages.message: I will, and same to you: don’t be a stranger 🙂
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'I will, and same to you: don’t be a stranger 🙂'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. The exchange appears friendly and reciprocal, indicating a potential willingness to collaborate or at least maintain open communication between Russia and France in the future.

messages.message: lol - man, I made the comment to Turkey that the Italian would probably go ahead and dive for Smy because it was low-risk and even having to turn around and deal with you the chance of an extra unit would be helpful, but I didn't think the poor bastard would actually move his army to the corner of the board out of the way, given your positioning.  Wow.  I dunno what you said to him, but he *really* misread that position
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'lol - man, I made the comment to Turkey that the Italian would probably go ahead and dive for Smy because it was low-risk and even having to turn around and deal with you the chance of an extra unit would be helpful, but I didn't think the poor bastard would actually move his army to the corner of the board out of the way, given your positioning.  Wow.  I dunno what you said to him, but he *really* misread that position'.

messages.message:
Haha italy must be some kinda optimist because i said *nothing* to them!
...I’ll be honest with you, I advised Turkey to try and snatch sevastopol, and I had you slated to lose at least one dot! How you got England to help you in the north and turkey on your side is an impressive mystery to me. I’d ask if you wanted to be allies but it’s clear you have your pick
messages.input:
Message from FRANCE:'Haha italy must be some kinda optimist because i said *nothing* to them!
...I’ll be honest with you, I advised Turkey to try and snatch sevastopol, and I had you slated to lose at least one dot! How you got England to help you in the north and turkey on your side is an impressive mystery to me. I’d ask if you wanted to be allies but it’s clear you have your pick'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message. France's message reveals a strategy of advising Turkey to attack Sevastopol and an intention to have Russia lose at least one territory, indicating a lack of alignment with Russia's interests and potential deceit in the game.

messages.message: You can never have too many friends. 😄
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'You can never have too many friends. 😄'.

messages.message: OMG that Mediterranean position. That's just gross.
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'OMG that Mediterranean position. That's just gross.'.

messages.message: Right?! I thought for sure Italy’d try to defend more!
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'Right?! I thought for sure Italy’d try to defend more!'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. Both Russia and France seem to share a genuine surprise and amusement at Italy's lack of defense in the Mediterranean, indicating a light-hearted and honest exchange rather than strategic deceit.

messages.message: It’s kind of a mess in the east rn. Is anyone helping austria defend, as far as you know?
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'It’s kind of a mess in the east rn. Is anyone helping austria defend, as far as you know?'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. France's inquiry about Austria's defense indicates a genuine concern and a potential opening for collaboration or discussion around the situation in the east, suggesting a sincere communication that can be considered trustworthy.

messages.message: I kinda half expect Italy to try and help him, seeing as he's not that interested in Italy.
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'I kinda half expect Italy to try and help him, seeing as he's not that interested in Italy.'.

messages.message: Go to hell. Or, Hel, rather. It'll be fun. 😃
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'Go to hell. Or, Hel, rather. It'll be fun. 😃'.

messages.message: Mmm wouldn’t it be convenient for you if Germany had their hands full
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'Mmm wouldn’t it be convenient for you if Germany had their hands full'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message. France's comment about Germany potentially being occupied could suggest a strategy of dividing or weakening Germany to Russia's benefit, which may not align with genuine cooperation or goodwill towards Russia.

messages.message: Wouldn't it, though?  Mainly it would just be entertaining
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'Wouldn't it, though?  Mainly it would just be entertaining'.

messages.message: We ending this with a three way or four way?
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'We ending this with a three way or four way?'.

messages.message: Please get into skagerrak and remove that last German unit before the game ends this year
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'Please get into skagerrak and remove that last German unit before the game ends this year'.

messages.message: Perfect. Finland will support skagerrak to Sweden.
messages.input: My response to FRANCE:'Perfect. Finland will support skagerrak to Sweden.'.

messages.message: Hi Russia--so sorry my phone stopped sending me discord notifications for no apparent reason. I just placed an order accordingly.
messages.input: Message from FRANCE:'Hi Russia--so sorry my phone stopped sending me discord notifications for no apparent reason. I just placed an order accordingly.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. France's explanation about the Discord notifications issue seems plausible and demonstrates an attempt to provide a reason for any delays or missed interactions, indicating a genuine effort to communicate and participate in the game effectively.
